trustfund:
TF040237-BOSNIA - PREPARATION OF
            FINANCIAL ASPECTS OF BOSNIA MOSTAR WATER SUPPLY,TF039362-BOSNIA-HERZEGOVINA - MOSTAR PRIVATIZATION,TF037798-BOSNIA-HERZEGOVINA - SOLID
            WASTE MANAGEMENT,TF025712-PHRD-MOSTAR WATER &
            SEWERAGE PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
Within the framework for preparation of
            the Mostar Water Supply, and Sanitation Project, the
            environmental assessment explores potential adverse effects
            on the environment. Although sewage collection systems are
            in place, waste water treatment is rare, and, industrial,
            and waste water effluents discharge - untreated - into the
            area's rivers. Furthermore, Mostar's surrounding
            areas, have no sewers, but latrines, rarely with any septic
            tanks. This poses serious bio-diversity threats, due to the
            potential effluent toxicity, and on the population's
            health, since the risks of insufficient quantity, and/or
            quality of drinking water, are high. Measures to mitigate
            adversity suggest, primarily, that adequate institutional
            arrangements enforce monitoring of microbiological, and
            physico-chemical testing, to control health, and sanitary
            risks. Inspection of industrial, and domestic effluent
            controls should be conducted to prevent ecological
            degradation. During construction, it is recommended to
            phase-out water supply systems, and, although solid waste
            management is not part of this report - in light of the high
            costs of waste water treatment plants -, the use of adequate
            septic tanks is recommended.
